intro: Galathea speciosa, commonly known as the golden star orchid, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), helping it retain moisture in its natural habitat. The flowers bloom during the rainy season, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
